name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Palm Desert Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It had been 6 years since we'd stayed at this Best Western. The rooms have become so dingy and tired. We were on the 3 floor with a balcony. The balcony is very dirty with two dirty tied single chairs. So dirty that we had to put towels on them to sit on them. The refrigerator door was barely hanging on. The room is on it's last legs. We looked in the "remodelled" rooms on the 1st floor that have laminate flooring and a new TV....but you could clearly hear the people above. So we picked the 3rd floor old rooms with no one above. The breakfast is cooked to order with two cooks. The one guy is like the soup Nazi from the Sienfield show. They have a few choices but don't try and get it different....OMG.....really. I wanted no potatoes but wanted yogurt....so in the end he made me have the potatoes and unhappily gave me the yogurt. They hide the fruit. And when the jam runs out .... that's it they don't refill them. Again, really? They told us that they are working to upgrade their status rating but adding some features but really it should be going down on the rating scale.
reviews.title: Very Tired

reviews.text: After a day of golf, we checked in so we could shower before dinner and there was no hot water. That problem was resolved by the time we got back from dinner, but the towels we were given were ready for the car wash --- very thin. The bed was OK and breakfast was good.
reviews.title: No Hot water

reviews.text: This is the second time we stayed at this hotel, and we have had a great experience both times. It is an older hotel, but is well kept, very clean and manicured grounds. They have a huge grassy area inbetween the buildings that is wonderful if you bring your dog along. The hotel was full when we stayed there this time, and we never heard a sound from any of the surrounding rooms. The full breakfast is included in your stay and is delicious The breakfast setting is nice, you can eat indoors or on their outdoor patio.
reviews.title: Delicious breakfast, friendly service, great value.

reviews.text: I stayed here on a golf trip with some friends. It is a decent hotel, nothing fancy but serviceable. It was clean and the staff was friendly . That's about all you can ask for for the price.
reviews.title: Decent for the price.

reviews.text: My friend and I were looking for something in Palm Springs close to the golf courses like Indian Wells and the PGA tournament that was going on in La Quinta. This hotel is on highway 111, the main drag through all of the towns comprising Palm Springs. It is central and close to malls, theatres, and most of the golf courses (Indian Wells was 2 minutes away, La Quinta about a 15-20 minute drive). Unfortunately I found the room to be fairly average to oldish - with a very strong smell of cleaning product that greeted us when we entered. The safe was not reset and the room wasn't serviced/cleaned until the late afternoon, which was a bit annoying to return to on our second day there. However the price was fairly reasonable and the location was nice and central in Palm Springs, so a decent hotel for the money overall.
reviews.title: good value, average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read the reviews and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights but barely got 1 good night's sleep. It felt like our neighbors were sleeping in our room - you could hear them snore, cough, drop something on the floor, flush, and engage in a few other things. The breakfast is great no doubt so that kind of makes up for the lack of sleep - coffee helped. Bring ear plugs or have a few strong shots at night to overcome the noise.
reviews.title: Good breakfast, decent location, but walls paper thin

reviews.text: We have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. The location is great and the price is within our budget. Most of our favorites restaurants are very close by as well as the golf courses we like to play. We keep coming back, over and over again. We did not get to go to the pool this time but we were able to see it from our room.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited this hotel for one night in October for a little getaway. (We're from L.A)
reviews.title: Great hotel for one-night getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good experience, but would probably stay closer to "the action" in Palm Springs next time.
reviews.title: Disorganized

reviews.text: We were given a ground floor room overlooking a courtyard and the pool. The room had hard wood floor which was kind of unique. The paint in the bath tub had seen better days, and it was an older style tube TV... but other than that everything else felt modern and clean.
reviews.title: Clean Place With a Nice Breakfast - Great Value
great location for golf
reviews.text: many rooms being renovated as older property. Staff helpful when information required. All amenities present which we required for our stay. Bed very comfortable and location quiet. Not much time for the pool area as the weather was below normal for most of the stay. The breakfast was great. Cooked to order. If you like to walk may do so down to El Pseo and take in all the happpy hour specials.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at BW Plus Palm Desert Resort, with perhaps the one exception of a loud party in the suite next door. Our one-bedroom suite was well appointed, clean and functional. The mattress was a bit too soft for my bride but I found it to be just fine. The TVs were the old style, but staff informed us that they're in the process of being switched out to the newer HDTVs. The location couldn't be much better with all the great shopping and sports attractions nearby. Very good find and we'll be back.
reviews.title: Courteous, accomodating staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older property, but kept up very well. The staff was fast and friendly. The rooms all have balconies and and overlook the courtyards and pool. The rooms have all the normal amenities such as safes, ironing boards, coffee makers, ect. The shower/tub was average, could use an update or remodel. The bed was comfortable and bedding warm. The free breakfast is the best! Cook to order eggs and bacon or sausage, and other items were a great value.
reviews.title: Perfect for short stays.

reviews.text: Clean, well located, courteous, helpful staff, and fair priced - that's what I found when the brother and I stayed at this BW Plus motel in Palm Desert. While you the usual package of service/facilities (pool, spa, gym, selfserve breakfast, room layouts, decor) as found in most Best Western hotels, this one was exceptionally clean, comfortable and attractive. Everything, literally, was in tip-top condition, in spite of the California near-desert weather. That sun can really cook paint/outdoor umbrellas and flowerbeds. But this BW staff work diligently to sustain the good-as-new buildings, gardens, rooms. We even met some interesting fellow travellers at breakfast or around the pool - unfortunately the BW staff dont get credit for that. So, in short, kuddos go to the staff and the corporation for the accomodation they provided here. We'll certainly go back.
reviews.title: A fine place to stay when golfing around Palm Desert region

reviews.text: It's unusual in an American hotel to get a free hot breakfast. Many other reviewers rave about the breakfast at the BW Plus Palm Desert Resort and I will not disagree. This is a great start to set you up for the day.
reviews.title: Great location, great price, great breakfast!

reviews.text: This place was a good price for the season, It is older. The rooms need paint but they are clean. It has an outstanding breakfast that is cooked to order! nice staff, good location.
reviews.title: Interesting place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone talks about the great breakfast. Yes, it was wonderful, it is made to order which is great but my prime concern is the room. The room was very worn and was not so clean. The carpet was dirty and I had to take the lamp shades out on the patio to dust off. I don't think they had been dusted in years. The linens were very worn and the bathroom was not very clean. The floor area around the toilet was unclean and the bathroom had a urine type smell. The ground are beautiful and the location is wonderful but I'm not sure I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Room could have been cleaner

reviews.text: This hotel was used by an out-of-state visiting group. The hotel was fine for us with the exception of the breakfast arrangements. A 6 am, as opposed to a 7 am, start would have been better. The freshly cooked eggs were appreciated but a more buffet style as at the Best Western Yucca Valley would have been better.
reviews.title: Excellent but for the breakfast arrangements

reviews.text: Went out to the desert for a two-day golf trip with a friend and needed somewhere basic and affordable to stay. Landed the Best Western Plus Palm Desert on Hotwire (listed as 3-star) for about $10 more than the online rate offered by the local Motel 6. It served us perfectly. The included breakfast was a nice perk, as was the balcony overlooking the pool and hotel grounds.
reviews.title: Perfect for Quick Golf Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location right on 111 near the border of Palm Desert and Indian Wells.
reviews.title: great place to stay

aka: Best Western Plus Palm Desert Hotel Palm Desert
description: Choose this pet-friendly Coachella Valley hotel located centrally in Palm Desert close to Indian Wells Tennis Gardens, PGA WEST golf course, and Joshua Tree National Park.Welcome to the BEST WESTERN PLUS Palm Desert Resort where guests can expect a friendly and knowledgeable staff, clean guest rooms with outdoor patios or balconies and a hot cooked to order breakfast. The hotel is situated in the heart of Palm Desert close to Highway 111 and minutes from Interstate 10.Enjoy the view from one of our 130 guest rooms or 22 suites with cable television with HBO and complimentary high speed internet access. Relax in the heated pool and spa with outdoor cooling mist system. Additional amenities include 2 tennis courts, exercise facility, business services and meeting facilities.The BEST WESTERN PLUS Palm Desert Resort located conveniently close to the Palm Springs Intl. Airport, Palm Springs Convention Center, and El Paseo Shopping District. Also within 20 minutes are 3 casinos (Fantasy Springs, Spa Resort Casino, and Agua Caliente Casino), Big League Dreams Sports Park, College of the Desert where they hold the street fair every weekend and the McCallum Theater.
